body_html:
The error is trying to tell you that no kernel for int64 Assign is registered; only int32 and float are registered.

Digging into this a bit, I see that this is controlled by this block of macros for our Pi builds:

tensorflow/tensorflow/core/framework/register_types.h

Line 117 in 3bafe0a

// Only float and int32 are supported.

So you have two options:

  1. Build tensorflow from sources yourself, including support for DT_INT64:
    https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/tools/ci_build/pi/build_raspberry_pi.sh
  2. Otherwise, you can find the code that's using int64, and change it to use int32 instead.

Hope that helps!

Note that technically this isn't a bug or feature request; in the future please ask these kinds of questions on StackOverflow since there is a larger community that reads questions there. Thanks!

Otherwise, you can find the code that's using int64, and change it to use int32 instead.

Hope that helps!
Note that technically this isn't a bug or feature request; in the future please ask these kinds of questions on  StackOverflow since there is a larger community that reads questions there. Thanks!
body:
The error is trying to tell you that no kernel for int64 Assign is registered; only int32 and float are registered.

Digging into this a bit, I see that this is controlled by this block of macros for our Pi builds:
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/3bafe0a86f67dd54197c6d60bdb5053f510de7d8/tensorflow/core/framework/register_types.h#L117

So you have two options:
1) Build tensorflow from sources yourself, including support for DT_INT64:
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/tools/ci_build/pi/build_raspberry_pi.sh
2) Otherwise, you can find the code that's using int64, and change it to use int32 instead.

Hope that helps!

Note that technically this isn't a bug or feature request; in the future please ask these kinds of questions on  [StackOverflow](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/tensorflow) since there is a larger community that reads questions there. Thanks!
